headline: Does the world fail at protecting the male? A new study finds men face more discrimination globally than women
subHeadline: Guests: Katherine Timpf, George "Tyrus" Murdoch, Jimmy Failla, David Angelo

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Why not sign the other bills though, so some of these workers can get paid, the government --

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You think I should do that?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No, no. Do you think I should do that, John?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I mean, it's not for me to say --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: And then I watch your one-side reporting, do you think I should do that? Hey, John. No, seriously, John, do you think I should just sign?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, the argument --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No, tell me. Tell me.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If you could sign the bill, it has nothing to do with border security.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: John, do you think I should just sign.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I am saying that if you sign that, these workers can start getting paid. The government --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: So you would do that if you were in my position, you would do that?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I am not in your position, I am asking you if that's something you --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I am asking you, would you do that if you were in my position? Because if you would do that, you should never be in this position because you'd never get anything done.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: I will never get tired of that. Yes, all right, after President Trump's address on the border, the Democratic Party sent out these two carnival cutouts as a rebuttal. All that's missing were the beanbags to toss through their pie holes. Talk about stiff, are we sure this wasn't a subtle promotion for the new season of "The Walking Dead"? Brought to you by the makers of formaldehyde. It's odorless, tasteless but keeps you in government for decades.  Look at him. Now, I'm not talking about how they look. That's too easy. It's just how they are, like a couple of greeters at Cigar World, old people get that. You want a wall. That's a wall. There's - they are so rigid they make Mike Pence look like this guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: To be that lawn, but it makes you wonder, what were they thinking?

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF., SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE
utterances.sentences: On the very first day of this Congress, House Democrats passed Senate Republican legislation --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Where am I? Where do I look? Straight ahead?

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: ... border security solutions.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Should I have worn my glasses? But they tickle my nose.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: ... which would reopen government.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Why does she get to speak first? She always does? I hate her.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: ... to waste billions of dollars ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And I have better hair. I pay a lot for it.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: ... and while he always promised --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Plus I'm a senator, so I get to stand on a little wooden box, do you know how many squirrels it took to make this weave?

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: ... held hostage critical services.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I love squirrels. They have big fluffy tails. One covers my bald spot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: True. Now if you're looking for proof of how truly screwed up government is, look no further. Trump's address wasn't earth-shattering. He colored within the lines. He stuck to the facts even repeating the same points that Democrats and the media had stated before. Still it didn't matter. The media was giddy with fact-checking.

utterances.speaker: BROOKE BALDWIN, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.sentences: Fact checkers, eat your Wheaties today.

utterances.speaker: JULIA AINSLEY, NATIONAL SECURITY AND JUSTICE REPORTER, NBC NEWS
utterances.sentences: Yes, we'll be fact-checking relentlessly.

utterances.speaker: HEATHER MCGHEE, NBC
utterances.sentences: They have to have real-time fact checking.

utterances.speaker: JIM ACOSTA, CORRESPONDENT, CNN
utterances.sentences: Setting the scene for an address that will test the fact checkers later on tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh they're so excited. They're like grade school kids around free ice cream or Kevin Spacey at a high-school wrestling match, but when the time came, there wasn't much to fact-check. The crime stats were legit. The number of kids abandoned factual. The anecdotes Trump listed sadly were all too real, which is why they had to redefine fact-checking as disgruntled commentary. Seriously, I wonder what they were thinking.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CHUCK SCHUMER, D-N.Y., SENATE MINORITY LEADER
utterances.sentences: We address you tonight for one reason only.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I could really go for a hoagie with ham, cheese, onions, lettuce, pickles, some mustard.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.sentences: ... and unable to convince ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Pastrami, salami, tomatoes, no, no tomatoes. More cheese. The cheese with holes.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.sentences: ... work that way. We don't govern by temper tantrum.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Why does cheese have holes? That seems looks like a rip-off. Talk about cheese with holes. Oh, god, what is that smell? Oh Chuck, not again. That is just deadly. See a doctor, please? I think something is dead inside you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And of course, the media made fools of themselves pretending there is no crisis when just weeks before, they were calling it a crisis themselves. Remember the caravan? Wasn't that a crisis? Not anymore.

utterances.speaker: AINSLEY
utterances.sentences: The big scam of the whole address was that there's a crisis. There's not a crisis.

utterances.speaker: RACHEL MADDOW, ANCHOR, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: The President's speech was a litany of scare stories about immigrants being terrible criminals.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.sentences: This is a crisis that he wants you to believe is worth shutting down, a manufactured crisis.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: So that address probably should have come with a Surgeon General's warning it was hazardous to the truth.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know that Acosta practiced that line in front of a CNN bathroom mirror and Don Lemon was like, "Killer line, Jim. Don't forget to flush." But damn, if Jimmy doesn't make Trump's points for him.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Here are some of the steel slats that the President has been talking about, right here, and as we're walking along here, we're not seeing any kind of imminent danger. There are no migrants trying to rush toward this fence here in the McAllen, Texas area. No sign of the national emergency that the President has been talking about. As a matter of fact, it's pretty tranquil down here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Okay, so here I am in front of a wall and there are no illegals crossing it. Some people might call that cause and effect, but not Jim, they have nothing to do with each other. You know he should do more of this. You know, "Here I am holding an umbrella in the rain and my god I am dry. Clearly, there's no rain. Now, when I put on these sunglasses, suddenly the sun's glare is gone. Obviously, the sun has gone missing," but I wonder if Trump appreciated the sales pitch.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Good job yesterday. I appreciate your sales pitch. I appreciate your sales pitch.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: I didn't see an invasion at the border.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Oh, you didn't, I now. That's because we had a wall.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh my god. I don't care. I don't care what you think of Trump. You could put him on Rushmore for that alone. As for poor Jim, that wasn't even the worst part of his week.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Can you promise that the President will tell the truth tonight? Will he tell the truth?

utterances.speaker: KELLYANNE CONWAY, COUNSEL TO PRESIDENT TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Yes, Jim, and do you promise that you will? The whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help you God --

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: I'm not the one who has the alternative facts problem like you do.

utterances.speaker: CONWAY
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, Jim, I know that's a -- make sure that goes viral. This is why, by the way, this is why I am one of the only people around here who even gives you the time of day.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Okay, can you guarantee that the President's speech will pass a fact check? Could you guarantee that he President's speech will pass a fact check?

utterances.speaker: CONWAY
utterances.sentences: Let me get back in your face because you're such a smart ass (inaudible), but let me just be respectful to the media at large because I always am. I explained that that was alternative information and additional facts, and I explain it many times and don't you put it back in my face for all the corrections that your networking has issued.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have a public service announcement.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And now a public service announcement.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If you happen to come across two fleshy prune sized orbs rolling down Pennsylvania Avenue, please put them on ice and promptly returned them to Jim Acosta.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This has been a public service announcement.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So the crisis is now a circus. How did this happen? Well, we know that the media makes everything worse, including even politics which is already the worst thing ever. Politics is the invisible gas that seeps into any discussion, removing nuance and compromise and replacing both with what I call the prison of two ideas and each side must pick their cell and never leave.  So even if Chuck agreed with Trump on immigration just a few years ago, it doesn't really matter. He's got to stay in his cell and the media makes it worse by turning these prisons into business models. There's no way MSNBC or the "New York Times" can make any money if Chuck and Nancy agree with Trump. Compromise doesn't sell advertising. Meanwhile, this is all made possible by two years of peace and prosperity. Seriously, the only way we can endure this kind of idiotic malfeasance is if all the big stuff is taken care of -- jobs, terror, economy -- because Trump has gone down his list and ticked off all the big things, the Dems can afford to indulge this lunacy, holding workers hostage and pretending walls are some immoral phenomenon that Trump somehow just invented. It's quite a spectacle. It makes you hate our government. It makes you want to turn off the news and God forbid, go talk to your family. Most of all, it makes you see things as they really are or rather who they really are and what they're really thinking.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: He promised to keep government shutdown for months or years.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Where am? I am I still here? I should be home by now. "The Greg Gutfeld Show" is on. He always has a good take on things.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: ... our borders, while honoring our values.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Sure he can be rude, but I usually find him to be spot-on in his analysis.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: ... the kind of strong new technology ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's a shame they canceled Sarah Silverman's show, maybe she can get a job writing for Greg Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: ... to facilitate trade.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What's that smell? Is that me? I've got to get out of here. Look out below.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. All right, his jokes are so good it almost makes you forget that he got dressed in the dark. Comedian Jimmy Failla. His jokes are so dry, each punchline comes with a bottle of water, comedian, David Angelo. She's had more bad dates than a stale fruitcake, "National Review" reporter, Kat Timpf. He's no muss, no fuss and likes to cuss, former WWE Superstar and my massive sidekick, Tyrus, host of "UnPC."  All right, Jimmy, how long do you think this is going to go on? What did you make of the whole week?

utterances.speaker: JIMMY FAILLA, AMERICAN COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: Wow, I have a lot invested in this because I consider myself a Dreamer because I'm a Knicks fan and I will have you know that I did get a compliment on this jacket today.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really? From who?

utterances.speaker: FAILLA
utterances.sentences: I appreciated it so much I stood there and pet his seeing-eye dog for like 10 minutes and I said thank you. This shutdown and though it is, it is so stupid because it's personal, and I say it's stupid as someone who locks his keys in the car twice a year. I am aware of my contribution to the discussion, but in any other era, any other era, they would have ended this in three days. He would gladly give them a piece of DACA funding or DACA approval and they would give him wall funding and we'd all move on. But they can't give him a win.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, they can't.

utterances.speaker: FAILLA
utterances.sentences: This is personal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it is. It is. It totally is.

utterances.speaker: FAILLA
utterances.sentences: It is petty and stupid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, what do you make of this, David? Thoughts?

utterances.speaker: DAVID ANGELO, AMERICAN COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: Well, they talk about this shutdown and what a tragedy it is. I had this week three letters from the IRS.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's amazing how that part doesn't shutdown?

utterances.speaker: ANGELO
utterances.sentences: Yes, and then they're on TV like oh, think of the poor government workers. It's like - I don't care. Is that wrong? I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know. I mean, it might be wrong. It might be insensitive, right, but then again, to call you insensitive that means nothing to you because you're insensitive.

utterances.speaker: ANGELO
utterances.sentences: Yes, I'm kind of like a bad boy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you really are. I think you live by your own rules.

utterances.speaker: ANGELO
utterances.sentences: I do, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You do. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, HOST: Good luck going through TSA, Bris.

utterances.speaker: ANGELO
utterances.sentences: Well, that's the other thing. Everyone is like, "Oh TSA, we miss TSA now." Listen, I am -- I hate them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You are definitely not a flyer.

utterances.speaker: ANGELO
utterances.sentences: I am.

utterances.speaker: FAILLA
utterances.sentences: I hate a letter from the IRS, but I've got an even shocking - more shocking letter this week.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: FAILLA
utterances.sentences: And I don't mean to brag, but I went to Community College and I got a fundraising letter from Nassau Community College. I'm like, "Dude, I went to Community College. I should be asking you for money." I'm like, you don't even know - you mailed this to a car, you don't even know if I have a house. Just sad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is true. All right, Kat, I know you're in the middle of a coughing spell.

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, REPORTER, NATIONAL REVIEW
utterances.sentences: Doing my best to keep it under control, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what, you're America's hero.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That is how I see myself. Is there a question? Do you want to hear about my cough? It started like two days ago. It's been getting progressively worse. I had a difficult time sleeping. Do you want to know about something else?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's go for something else.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Okay, this shutdown?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: You want to talk about the wall?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, the wall and the shutdown?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Well, I am talking about the wall. Look, I'm not for the wall personally, but the thing about me is I've like never been for it, whereas a lot of these Democrats were for a physical barrier before Trump started saying he was for a physical barrier. So it's not really about what they believe in, it's about them being so obsessed with the idea of being against Trump. They're completely obsessed with it. They say Trump's obsessed with the wall, but it's like if you have a friend who's like, "Oh my ex-boyfriend is so obsessed with me," but that's all they talk about, like what do you want to get for dinner? Well, oh my yes, my ex-boyfriend is obsessed with me. He used to eat dinner, too and he's so obsessed with me. It's like, it sounds like you're obsessed, too, Sharon, you know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you should not be - you shouldn't use Sharon's name. She's in the green room.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Well, she needs to know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I don't know. She's a bit unstable.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I think that public shaming is very effective in a free society.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I agree. All right, Tyrus, I have to say, whether you have disagreements with Trump over 80%, 90%, just his expert trolling to me means that he might be the greatest President we've ever had.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I don't know about greatest President, but he damn sure is a Hall of Fame bully, like straight up, like, I'm a little worried I might not get in now because he sets the bar. I've got to start you know going back to Melvin's and shoving guys in lockers again. Like this is - seriously ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You think that's bullying. I think it's hilarious.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: All right, meet me in a locker room sometime. We'll play.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know what that means.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I think that's - I think his ability to fire back is probably the worst part of the media's job because they usually write their stuff down. They're not improv guys, which is - what clearly is like on the fly, they've got nothing. Like Acosta with his little parent advisory, doctor advisory, that literally was written down and the guy was like, watch I hit him with this question you know, are you going to sign this just so they can get their jobs back? Would you? Huh? And the guy was like, "Well, I'm not in --" Answer question? Would you? And then he pees and then like he starts to shake, you know what I'm saying? Like this was great. It was like it was literally - I thought I was watching a few good neighbors like, did you want a code red or not? And the reporters were like, "No, please, stop." You know what I am saying? Like, I love the fact that he has like his way of doing things the same way. Mine is when I get caught and are in trouble or something, I turn around on you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: You know what I am saying? And his ability to turn around is amazing, like he will never lose a debate, ever, and like foreign countries have got to just be terrorizing in a closed room with him because he's never going to be wrong and if you don't have your stuff together, he's going to make you cry and wet your pants like that reporter. I guarantee you. I guarantee you, they're like, "Dude, you just peed your pants." "Because he asked me to answer a question."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, we've got to move. We've got so much more, including a nude restaurant. Yes, a nude restaurant. I've been wanting to do this story all year. But first, what do you call an Oscars without a host? Maybe finally, watchable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The host is toast, "Variety" - a magazine reports that the Academy Awards will move forward without a big-name emcee. By now you know that Kevin Hart was going to host, then dropped out because people dug up some old controversial tweets of his. So apparently, it was Kevin or no one. A million famous people, Oscars couldn't get one of them to host. You had one job, Oscars and he just gave up the. Did you ask William Devane? No. And he's awesome. You need someone to keep the show moving, get my Uncle Carl. He runs Bingo Wednesday nights. He'd totally do it. What about Alf? Alf. He will insult you, but you won't feel threatened. He's like a furry Don Rickles. How about Ted Cruz's beard? Did you ask Ted Cruz's beard? Not Ted, just the beard. I love that beard. You know, I understand it though you need an A-list person, squeaky clean, professional, no-nonsense, what you see is what you get. I know who should host.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But only if his wife co-host with him, right? That's it.

utterances.speaker: FAILLA
utterances.sentences: I got it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Jimmy, somebody got that joke. David, Kevin Hart, should he have dropped out completely? What do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: ANGELO
utterances.sentences: No, I don't think so. The thing is people, have the - expectations are too high for comedians. A comedian --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not for you.

utterances.speaker: ANGELO
utterances.sentences: It's true. A good comedian is a crazy person who can speak coherently for a short period of time, and when you need to do this whole thing with like, "Oh you're past," and all of that. That's why no one will do the hosting because it's like, stop, we don't want you digging through.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: ANGELO
utterances.sentences: And the best - the only good news is if you've been like in prison for the past 30 years, usually that's hard to get a job, but now they get out and they're like, you know employers are like, "Well, this guy, he killed a family in Kansas in 1971, but he's never been on Twitter," he starts Monday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, he left a bloody footprint, but he has no social media footprint.

utterances.speaker: ANGELO
utterances.sentences: Yes, perfect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tyrus, should Kevin Hart have stayed in and then destroyed the place? Wouldn't that have been the ultimate if he said, "You know, I'll do it" and then just completely let loose.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I think he destroyed the place by saying, "Nah, I'm good."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I think he - you know, when it comes to being a comedian, censorship it's just as bad as telling reporters what they can and cannot report on. You know, the day they start saying what you can't report on when it's like anything can be the news, anything can be a joke and most of most - especially in American culture, joking is how we close the gaps.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Making - bringing up stuff is how we change the way we think. We're closer with people with differences because we can laugh about it because we make it normal and it's like, "Oh, you're this way and I'm that way." Like, really you and me are a walking joke, but it works because in every other walk of life, if we didn't have humor between us --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You'd kill me.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes, probably. Or worse, you would have called the police on me when I went, "Hey, what's wrong? Why are you acting that way?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I still may do that.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: You know what I am saying? But the point is like, I applaud him for saying, "No. Forget it."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you're right though because the modern progressive movement is eliminating the lubrication that keeps people from killing each other. It's like if you remove humor, Jimmy, we're going to kill each other. The Oscars basically threw in the towel against the mob. They said, "We're not going to do it."

utterances.speaker: FAILLA
utterances.sentences: Yes, and to be honest with you, at first I thought it was a bad idea to have a show without a host and then I saw the host on the Golden Globes do their monologue, and I was like, yes, maybe, but I think the problem is, it is having a detrimental impact on society in a few ways. I mean, first of all, we've become so obsessed with words, you can't even call a moron, a moron anymore. You have to call them Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, and moron was quicker. Moron was quicker.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But who should host? Who should host?

utterances.speaker: FAILLA
utterances.sentences: Who should host? I'd agree with Alf at first, but he's an alien and Trump deported him. So he's gone.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nicely done.

utterances.speaker: FAILLA
utterances.sentences: He is on the other side, but again a lot of the PC stuff is you're right to say that we're caving into a group of insufferable people that we hate these people outside of Twitter. You know what I mean? No one would ever go to a party and bring up a joke you told 10 years ago and then shame you into leaving the party. You know why? Because those kind of people don't get invited to parties. That's the point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: FAILLA
utterances.sentences: But all of these like PC things are having a negative impact on society, like I read a study the other day that 40% of elementary school children are obese and they're not doing anything about it because they don't know they're obese. Yes, that's what happens when you eliminate bullying, you know what I am saying?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Always with the positive aspect. FAILLA; Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, last word, Kat, we have this insatiable persecution complex that we just want to persecute anybody. What's next? What's going to happen? I don't know.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: What's going to happen?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So the crisis is now a circus. How did this happen? Well, we know that the media makes everything worse, including even politics which is already the worst thing ever. There's no way MSNBC or the "New York Times" can make any money if Chuck and Nancy agree with Trump. Compromise doesn't sell advertising. Meanwhile, this is all made possible by two years of peace and prosperity. Seriously, the only way we can endure this kind of idiotic malfeasance is if all the big stuff is taken care of -- jobs, terror, economy -- because Trump has gone down his list and ticked off all the big things, the Dems can afford to indulge this lunacy, holding workers hostage and pretending walls are some immoral phenomenon that Trump somehow just invented. It's quite a spectacle. It makes you hate our government. It makes you want to turn off the news and God forbid, go talk to your family. Most of all, it makes you see things as they really are or rather who they really are and what they're really thinking.

What did you make of the whole week?

I guarantee you. I guarantee you, they're like, "Dude, you just peed your pants." "Because he asked me to answer a question."

You know, I understand it though you need an A-list person, squeaky clean, professional, no-nonsense, what you see is what you get. I know who should host.
